examples: He faced the terrible consequences of his mistakes

results.definition: oppose, as in hostility or a competition
examples: Jackson faced Smith in the boxing ring
The two enemies finally confronted each other

results.definition: be oriented in a certain direction, often with respect to another reference point; be opposite to
examples: My backyard look onto the pond
the two sofas face each other

results.definition: turn so as to face; turn the face in a certain direction
examples: Turn and face your partner now

results.definition: present somebody with something, usually to accuse or criticize
examples: We confronted him with the evidence
He was faced with all the evidence and could no longer deny his actions

results.definition: turn so as to expose the face
line the edge (of a garment) with a different material
examples: face the lapels of the jacket

results.definition: cover the front or surface of
examples: The building was faced with beautiful stones

results.definition: having a face or facing especially of a specified kind or number; often used in combination
